intro: Mariscus parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered mariscus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, small white or pale pink flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth texture. Mariscus parviflorus thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats.
